request.description:
Validates an officer invitation token and returns invitation details for onboarding.
This endpoint is called when an officer clicks the invitation link in their email.

response.name: Valid invitation token - returns LGA details for onboarding
Unauthorized - Invalid, expired, or already used invitation token
Not Found - Invitation not found or LGA no longer exists

request.description:
Completes the officer registration process with personal details and password setup.
Requires a valid invitation token obtained from the officer invitation email.

response.name: Complete officer onboarding with all details
Complete onboarding with minimum required fields
Bad Request - Missing required fields or invalid data format
Unauthorized - Invalid or expired invitation token
Conflict - Officer account already exists or token already used

request.description: Authenticates a user with email and password, returning JWT tokens for API access.
Generates a new access token using a valid refresh token.
Sends a one-time password (OTP) to the specified email address for verification.
Verifies the OTP sent to the email address for authentication.

request.description:
Registers a device token for push notifications.
Required for receiving push notifications on mobile devices and web browsers.

**Nigerian Context Examples:**
- Lagos State officers registering Android devices for certificate updates
- Abuja supervisors registering iOS devices for batch processing alerts
- Federal officials registering web browsers for system maintenance notifications

request.description:
Uploads a CSV file containing vehicle ownership data for batch processing.
Only officers can upload batches. The CSV must include the following columns:
• vin - Vehicle Identification Number (17 characters)
• make - Vehicle manufacturer (e.g., Toyota, Honda)
• model - Vehicle model (e.g., Camry, Accord)
• year - Manufacturing year (e.g., 2023)
• color - Vehicle color (e.g., White, Black)
• engineNumber - Engine identification number
• plateNumber - License plate number
• ownerName - Full name of vehicle owner
• ownerAddress - Complete address of owner
• ownerPhone - Phone number with country code
• ownerEmail - Email address of owner

Download the CSV template using the /template/download endpoint for the correct format.

response.name: Batch uploaded successfully and queued for processing

item.name: Download CSV template for batch upload

request.description:
Downloads a CSV template file that officers can use to format their vehicle data correctly for batch upload.
The template includes all required headers (vin, make, model, year, color, engineNumber, plateNumber, ownerName, ownerAddress, ownerPhone, ownerEmail) and sample data format.
Use this template to ensure your CSV file matches the expected format for successful batch processing.

request.description:
⚠️ **DEPRECATED**: This endpoint is deprecated in favor of automatic approval during batch processing.
VINs are now automatically approved/rejected based on verification results during batch upload.

Legacy function: Approves a pending certificate with optional certificate number, issue date, and expiry date.
Only supervisors and admins can approve certificates. The certificate must be in PENDING status.

Only supervisors and admins can reject certificates. The certificate must be in PENDING status.

request.description:
Marks an approved certificate as printed. This updates the certificate status to PRINTED
and records that the physical certificate has been generated and printed.
Certificates are automatically created as APPROVED during batch processing, and this endpoint
allows tracking when physical certificates are printed. Only users with access to the certificate can mark it as printed.

**Permission Rules:**
- Officers: Can print certificates they processed OR from batches they uploaded
- Supervisors: Can print certificates from their LGA
- Admins: Can print any certificate

request.description:
Downloads the certificate as a PDF document with official template and supervisor signature.
The PDF includes all certificate details formatted according to Nigerian government standards.

**Authorization Rules:**
- Officers can only download certificates from their own LGA
- Supervisors can download certificates from their assigned LGA
- Admins can download any certificate

API key for authentication (must have SINGLE_OPERATION permission)

request.description:
Process a single vehicle through the complete certificate generation workflow:
1. Verify VIN against national database
2. Validate vehicle details and owner information
3. Generate Proof of Ownership Certificate (POC)
4. Return certificate PDF URL

**Requirements:**
- Valid API key with SINGLE_OPERATION permission
- Complete vehicle and owner information
- VIN must be registered in the national database

**Process Flow:**
- VIN verification (real-time check)
- Vehicle approval (automated validation)
- Certificate generation (PDF creation)
- Secure storage and URL generation

item.name: Upload batch file for bulk certificate processing

header.description: API key for authentication (must have BATCH_OPERATION permission)

formdata.description: The batch file to be uploaded

request.description:
Upload a CSV or Excel file containing multiple vehicle records for bulk processing.

**Supported File Formats:**
- CSV (comma-separated values)
- Excel (.xlsx, .xls)

**Required CSV Headers:**
- VIN (Vehicle Identification Number)
- Make (Vehicle manufacturer)
- Model (Vehicle model)
- Year (Manufacturing year)
- Color (Vehicle color)
- Owner details (JSON object with first_name, last_name, phone, email, address)

**Process Flow:**
1. File validation and parsing
2. VIN verification for each record
3. Batch creation and queuing
4. Asynchronous processing (may take several minutes)
5. Results available via GET /public/results/{batchId}

**File Size Limits:**
- Maximum 10MB per file
- Maximum 10,000 records per batch

**Processing Time:**
- Small batches (< 100 records): ~1-2 minutes
- Large batches (1000+ records): ~10-30 minutes

header.description: API key for authentication (must have BATCH_OPERATION permission)

item.name: Get batch processing results and status

header.description: API key for authentication (same key used for batch upload)

request.description:
Retrieve the current status and results of a batch processing operation.

**Batch Statuses:**
- **processing**: Batch is being processed (VIN verification, certificate generation)
- **completed**: All records processed successfully
- **failed**: Batch processing failed (check error details)

**Response Data:**
- **certificates**: Successfully processed vehicles with PDF URLs
- **inbox_items**: Records that were rejected with reasons
- **statistics**: Total, approved, and rejected counts

**Usage Notes:**
- Poll this endpoint every 30-60 seconds for processing batches
- Results are available immediately for completed batches
- Failed batches will have error details in the response

response.name: Batch results retrieved successfully

  "contact_email": "jane.smith@example.com",
  "contact_phone": "08038383839",

  "purpose": "Accessing Vehicle data",
  "additional_info": "Need access to historical data"
}

request.description:
Submit a request for API key access to the VOMS public endpoints.

**Request Process:**
1. Fill out organization and contact details
2. Specify the state and LGA where operations will be conducted
3. Provide purpose and additional information
4. Submit request (no authentication required)

**Review Process:**
- Request is sent to system administrators via email
- Admins review organization legitimacy and requirements
- If approved, admin generates API key for the specified LGA
- API key is provided to the organization contact

**Timeline:**
- Initial review: Within 24-48 hours
- Approval/Generation: Within 1-3 business days
- Key delivery: Immediate upon approval

**Requirements:**
- Valid organization details
- Accurate state and LGA information
- Legitimate business purpose
- Contact information for key delivery

response.name: API key request submitted successfully

item.name: Generate API key for external organizations (Admin Only)

request.description:
Generate a new API key for external organizations to access public endpoints.

**Admin Requirements:**
- Must be logged in as a system administrator
- Must have ADMIN role assigned
- Can generate keys for any LGA in the system

**API Key Properties:**
- **LGA-scoped**: Keys are restricted to data from the specified LGA
- **Permission-based**: Can include SINGLE_OPERATION, BATCH_OPERATION, etc.
- **Auditable**: All key usage is logged and tracked
- **Revocable**: Keys can be deactivated by admins

**Security Considerations:**
- Keys should only be generated for verified organizations
- Use descriptive names for audit trails
- Set appropriate permission levels
- Monitor key usage patterns

**Response:**
- Returns the actual API key (store securely - shown only once)
- Key ID for management operations
- Associated LGA and permissions

response.name: API key generated successfully
